qas.question: The western colonies were invaded by whom during World War II?
According to the UN report, what was the count of people who perished due to famine?
What violent acts did the Showa regime commit?

answers.text: Manila massacre and the implementation of a system of forced labour

qas.question: Who defeated Japan during the World War II?
What colonies were attacked during WW I?
Who invaded the western colonies during WW I?
Who reported that 4  thousand people died do to famine and forced labour?
Who did Japan defeat in the South-East Asian theater?

context: During World War II, <a0_0><b5_0>Imperial Japan<b5_0/><a0_0/> invaded most of the former <b4_0>western colonies<b4_0/>. The Shōwa occupation regime committed violent actions against civilians such as the <a2_0>Manila massacre and the implementation of a system of forced labour<a2_0/>, such as the one involving <a1_0>4 to 10 million<a1_0/> romusha in Indonesia. A later <b6_0>UN<b6_0/> report stated that four million people died in Indonesia as a result of famine and forced labour during the Japanese occupation. <a3_0><b7_0>The Allied powers<b7_0/><a3_0/> who defeated Japan in the South-East Asian theatre of World War II then contended with nationalists to whom the occupation authorities had granted independence.
